bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Editor, National Cyclopedia of American Biography, October 22, 1928

div1.p: Laura Carter sends the editor corrections for a biographical sketch of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Editor, National Cyclopedia of American Biography, October 22, 1928
div1.opener:
Biographic
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
October 22, 1928.
Editor,
The National Cyclopedia of American Biography,
Care James T. White and Co., Publishers,
New York, N. Y.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I have just received, by special deliver, the enclosed sketch (“R.W.R.”)
of my Father, the late Assistant Surgeon General Henry Rose Carter,
which I thought had been sent you last fall! After having at that time made va-
rious pencilled corrections and omissions in the sketch, as re-
quested by your representative, who gave it to me personally, I sent
the sketch to Baltimore to a friend of my Father's, whose opinion I
value most highly, asking that he go over the sketch and my changes
therein and, if he had no further suggestions to make, that he mail
the sketch to you by registered mail at once. I was very anxious
for you to have this corrected sketch as, while deeply appreciating
the sympathetic and appreciative manner in which it is written there
were several statements which needed correction: among others, (1) Father
was nominated for the Nobel Prize, but did not receive it: (2) Father's
work on “extrinsic incubation” (“A Note on the Interval between In-
fecting and Secondary Cases of Yellow Fever” etc (1900) was one of
the several observations which determined the direction of the work of
Reed and his co-workers. Sir Ronald Ross' work on malaria and that
of Carlos Finlay of Cuba were also cited by Reed as contributary to
the findings of the Reed Board. I mentioned to your representative last
fall that both of these changes were important, as Father, as well as I,
would have deplored an over-statment of that credit to which he is entitled.
Of course, I thought the enclosed MS had been sent you long since and
and
-2-
can only hope that it will, even yet, reach you in its corrected form
before your Cyclopedia of American Biography goes to press.
With best wishes for your success, I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Laura A. Carter 1 enclosure.
Initialed "R.W.R.
